title: Why you procrastinate even when it feels bad

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between procrastination and responsible time management?

options.label: A
options.text: Procrastination involves delaying tasks that are not important, while responsible time management involves prioritizing tasks.

options.label: B
options.text: Procrastination involves delaying tasks that are not urgent, while responsible time management involves prioritizing tasks based on urgency.

options.label: C
options.text: Procrastination involves delaying tasks we said we would do, for no good reason, despite expecting our behavior to bring negative consequences.

options.label: D
options.text: Procrastination involves delaying tasks that are too difficult, while responsible time management involves breaking tasks into smaller elements.

multiple-choice.question: Which part of the brain is involved in emotional processing and threat identification?
What is the primary reason why people procrastinate, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: People procrastinate because they are lazy.

options.label: B
options.text: People procrastinate because they care too much about the task.

options.label: C
options.text: People procrastinate because they avoid tasks that evoke negative feelings, such as dread, incompetence, and insecurity.

options.label: D
options.text: People procrastinate because they lack self-discipline.

multiple-choice.question: Which group of individuals is more likely to procrastinate?

options.label: A
options.text: People who have difficulty regulating their emotions and those who struggle with high self-esteem.

options.label: B
options.text: People who have difficulty regulating their emotions and those who struggle with low self-esteem.

options.label: C
options.text: People who are highly organized and have a lot of free time.

options.label: D
options.text: People who are highly motivated and have a lot of energy.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common misconception about procrastin the body and brain, laziness is marked by no energy and general apathy.

options.label: B
options.text: Procrastination is always caused by laziness.

options.label: C
options.text: Laziness is the same as procrastination.

options.label: D
options.text: Procrastination is always caused by a lack of motivation.

multiple-choice.question: What are some strategies to break the cycle of procrastination?

options.label: A
options.text: Breaking tasks into smaller elements, journaling, removing distractions, and cultivating self-compassion.

options.label: B
options.text: Cultivating discipline and practicing strict time management.

options.label: C
options.text: Avoiding tasks altogether and focusing on more enjoyable activities.

options.label: D
options.text: Procrastinating on all tasks and hoping for the best.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of procrastination in the long run?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced stress levels and improved physical health.

options.label: B
options.text: Increased anxiety and depression, ongoing feelings of shame, higher stress levels, and physical ailments associated with high stress.

options.label: C
options.text: Improved time management skills and increased productivity.

multiple-choice.question: Why do people procrastinate tasks that evoke negative feelings?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are lazy and lack motivation.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are afraid of failure and put things off because they're afraid their work won't live up to their high standards.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are highly organized and have a lot of free time.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are highly motivated and have a lot of energy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the prefrontal cortex in the brain?
Why is it difficult to start a task when we are procrastinating?

options.label: A
options.text: Because we are lazy and lack motivation.

options.label: B
options.text: Because we are afraid of failure and put things off because we're afraid our work won't live up to our high standards.

options.label: C
options.text: Because we perceive the task as stressful or challenging.

options.label: D
options.text: Because we are highly organized and have a lot of free time.

title: Should you care what your parents think?

options.label: A

options.text: Defiant reactance is our deeper desire to make our own choices, while independent reactance is impulsively doing the opposite of what we're told.
